simulated_ratings.title: Primer (2004)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Cerebral sci-fi and consequences-driven thrills scratch my conspiracy-loving itch.

simulated_ratings.title: Firefly (2002)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Gorgeous lights aside, a wordless visual poem leaves me cold and impatient.

simulated_ratings.title: Bill Burr: I'm Sorry You Feel That Way (2014)
simulated_ratings.feeling: His blunt, cynical riffs are funny and sharp, though not all of it lands for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Brick (2005)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Hardboiled noir vibes in a fresh setting hit my taste for twisty investigations.

simulated_ratings.title: Jimmy Carr: Making People Laugh (2010)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Quick, rude one-liners get chuckles, but it feels disposable.

simulated_ratings.title: Big Trouble in Little China (1986)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Goofy fantasy action is fun enough, even if the camp sometimes grates.

simulated_ratings.title: Matrix, The (1999)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Slick, high-concept sci-fi action and reality-bending rebellion are right up my alley.

simulated_ratings.title: Adventures of Buckaroo Banzai Across the 8th Dimension, The (1984)

simulated_ratings.title: Sneakers (1992)

simulated_ratings.feeling: Tense, grounded action and meticulous tradecraft keep me locked in.

simulated_ratings.title: Bill Burr: Let It Go (2010)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Solid, abrasive laughs with enough bite to keep me engaged.

simulated_ratings.title: Harold and Kumar Go to White Castle (2004)

simulated_ratings.title: Robot Chicken: Star Wars (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Fast, irreverent Star Wars gags tickle my fandom and keep the laughs coming.

simulated_ratings.title: Endless Summer 2, The (1994)

simulated_ratings.title: Guinness (2015)

simulated_ratings.title: Soylent Green (1973)
